title: 113_s2082
content: The Act is titled the "Two-Midnight Rule Coordination and Improvement Act of 2014" and it involves the development of criteria for medically necessary short inpatient hospital stays. The Secretary will develop criteria for payment under Medicare for short inpatient hospital stays, considering medical necessity and stakeholder input. The Secretary will develop a payment methodology for short inpatient hospital stays under Medicare, ensuring budget neutrality and potentially reduced payment amounts compared to standard inpatient services. This will be part of the annual rulemaking process for the Medicare hospital inpatient prospective payment system for fiscal year 2015. The Secretary will develop a payment methodology for short inpatient hospital stays under Medicare, considering criteria developed under subsection (a). This methodology will be part of the annual regulations for the Medicare hospital inpatient prospective payment system for fiscal year 2015. Additionally, the Secretary will create crosswalks linking ICD-10 codes to CPT codes and vice versa within 2 years of the enactment of this Act. The Secretary will develop a crosswalk linking ICD-10 codes to CPT codes, allowing comparisons of inpatient and outpatient hospital services for Medicare payments. The proposed crosswalk will be open for public comment for at least 60 days. The Secretary will provide notice of the comment period for the proposed crosswalk linking ICD-10 codes to CPT codes through various channels, including publication in the Federal Register and announcements on the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services website. The Secretary will instruct the ICD-9-CM Coordination and Maintenance Committee to convene a meeting for public input on the proposed ICD-10-to-CPT crosswalk, and publish a final crosswalk after considering comments received. The Secretary will publish a final ICD-10-to-CPT crosswalk and update it annually. Using this crosswalk, a DRG-to-APC crosswalk will be developed for inpatient and outpatient hospital services using claims data. The Secretary will use claims data for inpatient and outpatient hospital services starting from fiscal year 2015. By June 30, 2017, the DRG-to-APC crosswalk will be published. The enforcement of the two-midnight rule will be delayed for admissions before October 1, 2014, under the Medicare program. The two-midnight rule applies to Medicare review contractors, prohibiting denial of claims for inpatient hospital services based on medical necessity or length of stay before October 1, 2014.
